intro: Microschwenkia guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan microschwenkia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in shaded, moist forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
